## UserNameType enum

Enumerates supported username formats.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare enum UserNameType 
```

## Enumeration Members

|  Member | Value | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  Display | <code>7</code> | A friendly display name, for example, “John Doe”. |
|  DNSDomain | <code>2</code> | A DNS domain name, for example, “thecompany.com”. |
|  DP | <code>9</code> | A user name associated with DigitalPersona identity database (formerly known as "Altus user"). |
|  NetBIOSDomain | <code>1</code> | NetBIOS domain name, for example, “THE\_COMPANY”. |
|  SAM | <code>3</code> | A MS Windows account name, e.g “the\_company<!-- -->\\<!-- -->jdoe” (domain<!-- -->\\<!-- -->user) or "the\_company<!-- -->" (domain only). |
|  SID | <code>8</code> | A user SID string, for example, “S-1-5-21-1004”. |
|  Simple | <code>4</code> | The account name format used in Microsoft(r) Windows NT(r) 4.0, for example, “jdoe”. |
|  UID | <code>5</code> | A GUID string, for example, “4fa050f0-f561-11cf-bdd9-00aa003a77b6”. |
|  Unknown | <code>0</code> | A name not associated with any Windows account, to be used for local databases only. |
|  UPN | <code>6</code> | A user principal name, for example, “jdoe<!-- -->@<!-- -->thecompany.com”. |
